parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front brake system can cause inconsistent and unsafe braking, leading to accidents or near-misses, and potentially resulting in serious injury or death.
symptoms: The front brake lever feels soft or spongy
requires multiple pulls or "pumping" to engage fully
has a delayed or inconsistent response
and may cause the brake lever to travel excessively before engaging.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inadequate illumination of the instrument cluster can make it difficult or impossible for drivers to read critical information, such as speed and engine RPM, at night, potentially leading to accidents or unsafe driving conditions.
symptoms: The instrument cluster is dimly lit
the speedometer and tachometer are difficult or impossible to read at night
the numbers on the instrument cluster are too dim to read
the instrument panel is not legible in low-light conditions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the wire harness under ignition can cause the traction control system to malfunction, leading to unpredictable vehicle behavior, and potentially resulting in accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The traction control system stops working
the needles on the dashboard bounce or fluctuate
the wire harness pulls or stretches when the handlebars are turned to the right.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Recall Repair and Service Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of dealerships to properly repair recalled vehicles can lead to ongoing safety issues, causing frustration and financial burden for vehicle owners.
symptoms: Dealerships may not replace recalled parts
or may deflect responsibility to other dealerships
leading to a lack of accountability and resolution.
